data.title: Excellent food and atmosphere!
data.text: Our whole experience at this restaurant was wonderful from the moment that we sat down outside in the covered patio. The service and food was excellent.  This is the first time that we have been here. The price was a little high for lunch but it was a special occasion for our family so we splurged.  I love the uniqueness of the building where it got to keep it's original flavor and history yet it was repurposed. Great job guys!

data.title: Dog-friendly Deck
data.text: Dropped off my wife before parking, they saw the dog and mentioned the deck was still open and is dog-friendly so Gus joined us for dinner.  Friendly, attentive service.  Nice variety of menu items, though we were out for a lighter dinner.  Lori loved her grilled cheese and the Bun less Oven Bake.  Nice sized deck for outdoor eating, but the interior is very comfortable and unique for indoor dining.  Decent prices.  We will be back.

data.title: It's the small stuff,  it adds up
data.text: Meals were tasty and prepared nicely,  portion size perfect., Ordered an appetizer,  nacho dip to share for four.  Server brought enough chips for two,   when we asked for more,  she brought maybe 10 more individual chips.  We were left with half our dip with nothing to scoop with.  I guess we have to bring our own bag to have enough! Also asked multiple times for water to be refilled with no success,  ended up drinking my husband's water. No plans to return with that kind of service.

data.title: Woody's is always good food
data.text: This is a gem of Carmel dining.  If you live in Carmel you have probably been here.  If you have not, put it on your list.  Formal dining upstairs, and casual bar atmosphere downstairs.  The menu is the same, and the food is very good.

data.title: Never can go wrong eating here...
data.text:
I've been going here for 5 years...not once had a bad meal. Pot Roast sliders, fish tacos, prime rib, grilled cheese, tomato soup, cheeseburger soup, wedge salad...its all good!!

This time, I changed it up, had sloppy joe sliders...excellent! As always, Kay's service is great.

data.title: Interesting - Worth a Try
data.text: My first time here.  Some good and some just OK.  The house salad was mostly just lettuce and pretty bland.  I went with the fish and chips; the fish (tilapia) was very good but the fries were regular crinkle cut out of the bag.  I really liked the desserts.  They are moderately priced and sized.  Not overwhelming like some places.  The peach cobbler was extremely good.  I'll have to try again to really decide how I feel about this one.

data.title: Sweet reclaimed spot to eat...and a huge deck too for lots of diners.
data.text: We lunched early on a Tuesday and the bartender did his best for us.  My pot pie was just fine, but not the best I've ever had.  The grilled cheese was excellent, as was the mac-and-cheese spirals.  This is a tiny spot, but unlike any other.  Carnegie created a couple of thousand libraries with his wealth and that's why this library was created and now lives on as a Main Street destination for tasty fare.  Mangia!

data.title: Horrible ownership
data.text:
Was a regular at this place until the owner decided not to right a wrong.  Prime rib was always a favorite. Had my son order and he did not like it but didn't want to say anything when the server asked. After he only had a couple of bites I finally tasted it myself and it was horrible. Something definitely not right and not like the other times I had enjoyed it. So, I called the server back and said its just not tasting good and asked if they could make another. She had to check with owner, he in turn came over and said he could not prepare another one since my son (age 12) originally said it was fine. I was floored by that response and explained my history with the prime rib as always being good but this time it was just tasting all wrong. 
He never offered to fix like a burger or something else. We will never visit this place again. Too many other great choices in the area.

data.title: Yummy!
data.text: My family and I recently decided to eat at Woody's. We were lucky enough to be there during their 1/2 price appetizers. EVERYTHING we ordered was delicious!! My favorite was the baked goat cheese. Highly recommended! You can't go wrong.

data.title: Great Service, Food and Drinks!
data.text: The fish aquarium was beautiful when we arrived. Loved our salads and pretzels sticks! Service was great!  Went 3 times while downtown area.

data.title: Nice to visit and food is great
data.text:
We stopped here for work team happy hour and drink selection is plentiful,  waitress is on top of it, and food selection for happy hour is outstanding. 

Happy hour prices for food is really nice!

data.title: We loved this place!
data.text: We were driving to Indy and stopped in Carmel for lunch, on a whim chose this restaurant. Outdoor seating was perfect, food great with awesome service. We will definitely be back!

data.title: Love this place! Great atmosphere and food!
data.text: We enjoyed a delicious  lunch on the porch in July. Inside is a really cool library atmosphere. The is a large outside covered porch which is where we enjoyed our lunch.  The menu had a WIDE variety of options to include quoina, hummus, salads, tacos  and other unique items that you don't see at a lot of places. We also enjoyed a nice glass of wine.  Average prices.

data.title: Lunch
data.text: Stopped by Woody's for lunch and stayed for a few hours. Woody's new deck provides the best outdoor dining experience in Carmel.

data.title: Last minute find!
data.text: In Carmel area for baseball and didn't get out till 9 pm. Stumbled into Woody's thinking it was cute from the outside and was as equally impressed on the inside. It was not overly crowded due to time of night. Our waiter was very attentive and our overall experience was extremely pleasant. We split a tasty tuna appetizer, a wedge salad, and prime rib. All were above average. The waiter described a 1/2 off wine deal we tried and a small bite dessert the was yummy and perfectly portioned for us since we done eat sweets often. We'd definitely go back.

data.title: A New Take on Fish and Chips
data.text:
Peggy and I stopped by here for dinner the other evening on our way back from Lake Wawasee. We parked in the arts district and chose Woody's because of the name.
I had the fish and chips, which I often like to try. It was tilapia, but prepared differently than I had had before. The fillet was brushed with egg and then rolled in crumbled kettle chips before being cooked, giving a crunchy exterior and a different taste than I usually find. It was good, just not what I'm used to. The fries and slaw were pretty typical.
Peggy had the chicken club wrap and she substituted up to sweet potato fries. The wrap was good, and she thought the fries were even better than the ones she raved about at The Frog Tavern just a day earlier.
Alyssa was prompt and friendly. We ate outside, since it was a beautiful evening, although eating inside the old Carnegie Library building could be good on our next visit. There were several families with small children eating in the outside area, and one fellow even had his dog with him. They have a nice bar area in the basement, and the upstairs seating areas are surrounded by books.

data.title: Great outdoor dining!
data.text: We happened by the building while enjoying Carmel for the weekend.  Decided to go back for dinner and we were glad we did.  The wait staff are professional, friendly and efficient.  The food was very good and came in large portions.  If you are visiting Carmel you should stop in for a meal!

data.title: Lunch but gotta go back now!
data.text: Went here for lunch and it was a good meal and nice atmosphere. BUT wait Woody's just put a new deck out in front right on Main St. It looks like a lot of fun and would love to hear some reviews on the new outdoor seating.

data.title: Fantastic find!
data.text: We had a big group in town for a swim meet, the food was great, great service, unique location. Would definitely hit it again when in town!

data.title: Great Find
data.text: We had dinner here on our way to an event in Carmel. What a surprise to find such a quaint little place.  Ryan, our waiter absolutely enhanced our experience. He greeted us with a smile and a casual easy going style. He made some great suggestions. My friend had the prime rib and I had the fish and chips. Both were excellent. We ordered a wedge salad which we intended to split, Ryan brought that out already split and on separate dishes. It was a great salad, dressing just right not smothered. Ryan suggested the wine and we were very pleased. I recommend this one for a great easy going evening, in fact we are going to invited some of our friends and return to this neat establishment.
